critique: The document is an executive order from 1943 related to the Denison Dam Project and the distribution of electric power during World War II. It prioritizes the allocation of power to war plants and establishments, public bodies, and cooperatives. The order centralizes control over power distribution under the Secretary of the Interior and aims to ensure a dependable market for the power generated by the dam. It also addresses potential shortages of materials like copper by authorizing the Secretary of the Interior to allocate transmission lines. The document reflects a strong federal role in managing resources and prioritizing war efforts.
